stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements best describes the privacy of the customer’s payment information?

features.html:
The following class is used to store information about a customer.

 

public class Customer 
{
   public String cName;        // The customer's name 
   public String cPaymentInfo; // The customer's payment information
  
   /**
    * Returns the customer's name
    */
   public String getName() 
   { /* implementation not shown */ } 
  
   /**
    *  Returns the customer's payment information
    *  when a correct password is entered
    */
   public String getPaymentInfo(String password) 
   { /* implementation not shown */ }
  
   /* There may be other methods that are not shown. */ 
}

choicesHtml: It is considered private because retrieving it requires a password.
It is considered private because the value of the instance variable  cName  is not easy to guess.
It is not considered private because the instance variables are declared  public.
It is not considered private because the  getName  method has no password parameter.
